channel.title: HTML Editor
channel.description: I recently started learning HTML, and I must say, it is amazing so far and simple at that. With that being said, I was wondering if anyone knows a good editor to use, whether it is free or not. I've heard a lot of good feedback about Dreamweaver, but I just want to be sure before I take any actions.

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @Hyperius Hyperius
item.description:
@Hyperius wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:5, topic:478194”]Notepad++ for me too, does all I need and helps you learn the language quicker than a WYSIWYG editor, stay away from those.

On the subject, just got myself a Macbook Air for my web tech course, are there any editors similar to Notepad++ anyone would know of? I’ve had a look at Komodo edit and Textwrangler so far.[/quote]
Yeah, notepad++ dude.
Btw, SilentCJ use Textwrangler best I’ve seen in the mac range. I’ll scavenger the internet a bit and keep you updated on any newer or better recommendations.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:11, topic:478194”]As RSCShadow said, if you’re wanting to actually learn website development, quick. Stay away from WYSIWYG’s or things that auto complete the tags for you. I would also highly recommend Notepad++.[/quote]There’s nothing wrong with tag-suggestion or auto-completion IMO. They can reduce the repetitiveness of typing things out and you’re almost always able to disable them.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

As RSCShadow said, if you’re wanting to actually learn website development, quick. Stay away from WYSIWYG’s or things that auto complete the tags for you. I would also highly recommend Notepad++.

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:9, topic:478194”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=596392.msg4202284#msg4202284 date=1358383139]
On the subject, just got myself a Macbook Air for my web tech course, are there any editors similar to Notepad++ anyone would know of? I’ve had a look at Komodo edit and Textwrangler so far.
[/quote]
http://www.sublimetext.com/[/quote]
Just downloaded that a couple of hours ago few people on my course recommended it too.

Will check out those too Ecko, cheers

Read full topic

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:5, topic:478194”]Notepad++ for me too, does all I need and helps you learn the language quicker than a WYSIWYG editor, stay away from those.

On the subject, just got myself a Macbook Air for my web tech course, are there any editors similar to Notepad++ anyone would know of? I’ve had a look at Komodo edit and Textwrangler so far.[/quote]
http://www.aptana.com/

Fraise is another one that I’ve heard of:

GitHub

jfmoy/Fraise

Fraise is a lightweight but powerful text editor for Mac OS X.

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @Sibor Sibor
item.description:
@Sibor wrote:

Notepad++ is the way to go. It is colored coded for many, many languages. I use it and I love it, lol.

The reason I hate Dw is because I’m so use to closing the tags myself that I forget it does it for me and I have to delete it which pisses me off. So… definitely notepad++!

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:2, topic:478194”]Don’t use Dreamweaver or other WYSIWYG editors. Try Sublime Text, it’s a simple editor with some automatic completion and linting.

If you must use an Adobe product for some reason, try https://github.com/adobe/brackets[/quote]
Thanks, trying it now.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Editor
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Don’t use Dreamweaver or other WYSIWYG editors. Try Sublime Text, it’s a simple editor with some automatic completion and linting.

If you must use an Adobe product for some reason, try https://github.com/adobe/brackets

Read full topic
